Class RomanToArabicCalculation

  • java.lang.Object

extends java.lang.Object

        Boolean, whether the roman numeral passed the test or not

      • correctValuesInARow

        private static java.lang.Boolean correctValuesInARow()
        Validation check to see if the roman numeral has too many of the same character in a row
        Returns:
        Boolean, whether the roman numeral passed the test or not

      • correctValueOrder

        private static java.lang.Boolean correctValueOrder()
        Validation check to see if roman numerals pairs are in the correct order. Calls a method to validate if the previous character is the correct magnitude less.
        Returns:
        Boolean, whether the roman numeral passed the test or not

      • compareCurrentAndPrevious

        private static java.lang.Boolean compareCurrentAndPrevious(java.lang.String currentCharacter,
                                                           int i)
        Helper method for correctValueOrder. Checks to see if the previous character is the correct magnitude less than current one.
        Parameters:
        currentCharacter - The current character being checked
        i - The position of the character being checked
        Returns:
        Boolean, whether the roman numeral passed the test or not

      • correctAscending

        private static java.lang.Boolean correctAscending()
        Validation check to make sure that three characters in a row are not in accending order. IE: IVX is an invalid roman numeral.
        Returns:
        Boolean, whether the roman numeral passed the test or not

      • calculateArabicNumeral

        private static int calculateArabicNumeral()
        Once validation is completed, this method will convert a roman numeral to a arabic numeral
        Returns:
        int, represents an arabic numeral.
